page.title: 01INTRO PAGE
page.content: { {OUR BLOCK COVERS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE TOWN OF LARKHALL AND THE COUNTRYSIDE TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE TOWN.THE TOWN ITS SELF IS A FORMER MINING TOWN IN AND AROUND WHICH 30 PITS WERE WORKED BEFORE 1950.HOWEVER THESE PITS WERE SMALL WITH A MAXIMUM WORK FORCE OF ABOUT 100 MEN. THE LAST PIT CLOSED IN 1969.SURPRISINGLY THERE ARE FEW SIGNS TO BE SEEN IN THE AREA OF LARKHALL'S MINING INDUSTRY, THE FEW COAL BINGS TO BE SEEN AROUND THE TOWN ARE FAIRLY SMALL AND ARE OVER GROWN, LOOKING AT FIRST SIGHT SIMPLY LIKE GRASSY KNOLLS.HOWEVER, SINCE THE CLOSURE OF THE PITS, THE TOWN HAS ACTUALLY EXPANDED BECAUSE OF THE TOWN'S FAVOURABLE LOCATION ASTRIDE THE GLASGOW TO LONDON MOTORWAY AND THE A71 RUNNING EAST-WEST FROM EDINBURGH TO AYR.
